Package io.smint.clapi.consumer.integration.app.authenticator

Class SystemBrowserAuthenticator

java.lang.Object
io.smint.clapi.consumer.integration.app.authenticator.SystemBrowserAuthenticator
All Implemented Interfaces:
io.smint.clapi.consumer.integration.core.authenticator.ISmintIoAuthenticator
public class SystemBrowserAuthenticator extends Object implements io.smint.clapi.consumer.integration.core.authenticator.ISmintIoAuthenticator
Authenticator to initially create an OAuth 2.0 authorization token with Smint.io API.

This authenticator opens the browser and starts the OAuth 2.0 authorization with Smint.io. At the end of it, Smint.io API redirects to a localhost url (). This authenticator creates a HTTP service to listen to that URL and will receive the OAuth 2.0 token through this URL. Afterwards the token will be written so the IAuthTokenStorage and the HTTP service will be terminated.

  • Field Details

    • SMINTIO_OPEN_IO_AUTHORITY_URL

      public static final String SMINTIO_OPEN_IO_AUTHORITY_URL
      The OAuth 2.0 (OpenID) URL to the Smint.io authority, which has to be called for initiating OAuth authorization.

      The placeholder {0} will be replaced with the tenant ID, fetched from ISettingsModel.getTenantId(). 

       SMINTIO_OPEN_IO_AUTHORITY_URL ="https://{0}.smint.io/.well-known/openid-configuration"
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • openSystemBrowser

      public SystemBrowserAuthenticator openSystemBrowser(URL url) throws IOException, URISyntaxException
      Opens the system browser on the machine running this code and makes the browser open the URL.

      The browser is opened in a separate process.

      On every operating system supported, there are helper commands available to actually find and select the system browser. These helper tools will open the browser and pass the URL to it. There might be more operating systems with such helpers, that are still unsupported. In that case, send an email to the developer of this code. The currently supported platforms are:

      • Windows - helper start
      • MacOS - helper open
      • Linux with a Desktop - helper xdg-open
      Parameters:
      url - the browser will open this URL initially. if null, no browser will be opened.
      Returns:
      this
      Throws:
      IOException - see Runtime.exec(String)
      URISyntaxException - if conversion to URI failed with URL.toURI().
